sen.j: 眉輪王（まよわのおおきみ、允恭天皇39年（450年） - 安康天皇3年（456年）8月 (旧暦)）は、記紀に伝えられる5世紀頃の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa [(眉輪王) Mayowa no Okimi; born '450', then died in August of '456'] appeared in the Kiki, ["Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)] as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century in Japan.

Prince Mayowa (Mayowa no Okimi; born in 450, and died in 456) appeared in Kiki, ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century in Japan.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の訂正、規定により旧暦の８月の削除、しました。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa (Mayowa no Okimi; born in 450, and died in 456) appeared in Kiki, ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) as an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century in Japan.
Prince Mayowa (眉輪王) was also written as "目弱."
Prince Mayowa (眉輪王) was also written as目弱王.
sen.cmt: 目弱→目弱王に訂正および、ダブルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa (眉輪王) was also written as 目弱王.
sen.cmt: スペース調整

sen.j: 父は大草香皇子（おおくさかのみこ。仁徳天皇の皇子）。
sen.e: The father of Prince Mayowa was Imperial Prince Okusaka, [(大草香皇子) Okusaka no Miko; He was a prince of the Emperor Nintoku.]
The father of Prince Mayowa was Imperial Prince Okusaka, (Okusaka no Miko; he was a prince of the Emperor Nintoku.)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の訂正、およびHe→heに変更しました。一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The father of Prince Mayowa was Imperial Prince Okusaka, (Okusaka no Miko; he was a prince of the Emperor Nintoku.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は中蒂姫命（なかしひめのみこと。履中天皇の皇女）。
sen.e: The mother of Prince Mayowa was Princess Nakashi, [(中蒂姫命) Nakashi no Mikoto; she was a princess of the Emperor Richu.]
The mother of Prince Mayowa was Princess Nakashi, (中蒂姫命, Nakashi no Mikoto; she was a princess of the Emperor Richu.)
sen.cmt: []の変更しました。一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The mother of Prince Mayowa was Princess Nakashi, (中蒂姫命, Nakashi no Mikoto; she was a princess of the Emperor Richu.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 記紀によれば、父の大草香皇子が罪無くして安康天皇に誅殺された。
sen.e: According to the Kiki, Imperial Prince Okusaka, the biological father of Prince Mayowa was killed by execution as a criminal ("chusatus" in Japanese) despite his innocence; the Emperor Anko was behind this execution.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to the Kiki, Imperial Prince Okusaka, the biological father of Prince Mayowa was killed by execution as a criminal ("chusatus" in Japanese) despite his innocence; the Emperor Anko was behind this execution.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: According to the Kiki, Imperial Prince Okusaka, the biological father of Prince Mayowa was killed by execution as a criminal ("chusatus" in Japanese) despite his innocence; the Emperor Anko was behind this execution.

sen.j: 後、母の中蒂姫命は安康天皇の皇后に立てられ、眉輪王は連れ子として育てられた。
sen.e: After this incident, Princess Nakashi, the mother of Prince Mayowa became the Empress of the Emperor Anko; Prince Mayowa was raised as the step child of the Emperor Anko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After this incident, Princess Nakashi, the mother of Prince Mayowa, became the Empress of the Emperor Anko; Prince Mayowa was raised as a step child of the Emperor Anko.
sen.cmt: カンマを付け、the→aに変更しました。
sen.e: After this incident, Princess Nakashi, the mother of Prince Mayowa, became the Empress of the Emperor Anko; Prince Mayowa was raised as a step child of the Emperor Anko.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安康天皇3年（456年）8月、年幼くして（記に7歳とする）楼（たかどの）の下で遊んでいた王は、天皇と母の会話を残らず盗み聞いた。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa was playing under the tower ("takadono" in Japanese) in August of '456'; still a young child (according to recorded document he was seven years old), he over heard the entire conversation about his fathers death, between the Emperor Anko and his mother, no words were left out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Mayowa was playing under the tower ("takadono" in Japanese) in 456; still a young child (according to recorded document he was seven years old), he overheard the entire conversation about his father's death, between the Emperor Anko and his mother.
sen.cmt: 年代表記、overheardとfather’s の訂正、, no words were left out.の部分を変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa was playing under the tower ("takadono" in Japanese) in 456; still a young child (according to recorded document he was seven years old), he overheard the entire conversation about his father's death, between the Emperor Anko and his mother.
sen.cmt: “ ” → " "アポストロフィ ’→ '

sen.j: 亡父が天皇によって殺されたことを悟り、熟睡中の天皇を刺殺する（眉輪王の変）。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa realized that his late father was killed by the Emperor Anko, later he would stab the Emperor Anko, killing him while he slept. (This was known as the Conspiracy of Prince Mayowa.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Mayowa realized that his late father was killed by the Emperor Anko, later he stabbed the Emperor Anko to death while he was sleeping (this was known as the Conspiracy of Prince Mayowa.)
sen.cmt: would の削除、刺殺の訳、ピリオドの位置を変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Mayowa realized that his late father was killed by the Emperor Anko, later he stabbed the Emperor Anko to death while he was sleeping (this was known as the Conspiracy of Prince Mayowa.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、坂合黒彦皇子と共に円大臣の宅に逃げ込んだ。
sen.e: Later, Prince Mayowa and Prince Sakai no Kurohiko [(坂合黒彦皇子) Sakai no Kurohiko no Miko] ran into the residency of 'Tsubura no Okimi' (円大臣). but the army of Prince Ohatsuse [(大泊瀬皇子) Ohatsuse no Miko; later, he became the Emperor Yuryaku] attacked them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: ater, Prince Mayowa and Prince Sakai no Kurohiko (Sakai no Kurohiko no Miko) ran into the residency of Tsubura no Okimi.
sen.cmt: 本文にない記述を削除し、シングルクオートも削除しました。
sen.e: ater, Prince Mayowa and Prince Sakai no Kurohiko (Sakai no Kurohiko no Miko) ran into the residency of Tsubura no Okimi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: が、大泊瀬皇子（後の雄略天皇）の兵に攻められた。
sen.e: But, the army of Prince Ohatsuse [(大泊瀬皇子) Ohatsuse no Miko; later, he became the Emperor Yuryaku] attacked them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: But, the army of Prince Ohatsuse (Ohatsuse no Miko; later, he became the Emperor Yuryaku) attacked them.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更しました。
sen.e: But, the army of Prince Ohatsuse (Ohatsuse no Miko; later, he became the Emperor Yuryaku) attacked them.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、大臣の助命嘆願も空しく、諸共に焼き殺されたという。
sen.e: Then, Tsubura no Okimi pleaded for the life of the princes to be spared; but his effort was in vain, and Prince Ohatsuse ordered the princes to be burned together till death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In spite of a plea by Tsubura no Okimi for sparing their lives, they were burned to death.
sen.cmt: 書き直しました。

sen.cmt: 修正なし
